Room1_Text.text: Evelyn's Place
Mom, you're back! I've almost got it - <delay 250>the new recipe for our special pancakes!
A new recipe? Why?
The Snuggford Times' Top 10 Dishes. We could put on a special event tomorrow, so people vote for us!
Oh, I don't know, Emily... <delay 250>How could pancakes ever compete with steaks and lobsters?
I know Lobster Paradise wins first place every year, but people love our food, too!
Leave it to me, Mom!  I'm still perfecting the recipe, but I'll get you guys on that list - I promise!
Emily! Stop EVERYTHING. <delay 250>I just took the most AMAZING class - Intro to Fortune Telling!
What? Frank, I'm working on the syrup for my special pancakes, I don't have time for-

Come on, I need to practice with someone!
Here - drink this tea, PLEASE? For your friend?
Alright, alright... But you have to help me out after that!

Wow... Oh, WOW!<delay 250> This IS interesting...<delay 250>
These tea leaves... Could it really be...?
Hurry up already! What do they say?

Oh, it's all so clear! You'll find true love...
<delay 250>VERY soon.
True love? Please, have you seen my social calendar lately?
Ask for your money back, Frank. That class was definitely a scam.
Vrooom, vrooom!
Hey, go get your bike tuned up! I can't focus my psychic powers with all that noise!
Frank, would you stop that already?
I'm telling you - the leaves never lie! Besides, you just happened to have a cup ready when I arrived, that has to mean something!
Wait, what? I thought YOU brought the tea!
...Okay, so you just drank someone else's tea. Does it matter? At least you'll find love!
You found love!? That's great, Emily! Ever since Jean-Paul, you haven't had a serious-
Okay, enough! I don't have time for this right now, I still have tons to do before tomorrow.
I guess I should know better than to bring up Jean-Paul...
Why? Their red-hot summer romance was YEARS ago. Besides, it really was beautiful.
Yes, it was... until she returned from Paris and never heard from him again.
True love... Who believes in that sort of thing anymore?
It's so late already... and there's so much to do... Can't... rest...
Oh, Jean-Paul, these flowers are beautiful! There's even lavender... But why are you here?
Emily... I know we said it was impossible - that we live on opposite sides of the world and shouldn't see each other anymore...
But I'm not ready for it to end. I've never been happier. I... I think I'm in love with you!
I'm not ready for it to end either, Jean-Paul! I love you, too! ...But what are we supposed to do? We said we wouldn't-
Forget what we said, Emily! Give me your number. I'll call you, we'll figure it out!
Then why didn't you? <delay 250>I gave you my number but you never called... <delay 250>why?
What? No, I tried but-
Vrm...vrrroom...
I can't hear you! The train's taking off...
Listen, I actually did-
Vrooom, vrooooom!!
It's seven already? If I don't hurry I won't finish the syrup on time!
I finally made it - the perfect syrup for my special pancakes! It's lavender-based, and I had just enough to make this batch.
Wow, Emily, it looks great! Speaking of greatness, I mopped the floor like you asked, so we're all set!
Vrooom Vrooom!!
That bike again! I swear to God...
Actually, that bike is how I woke up on time. I never would have made it otherwise.
Looks like he's coming in - here's you chance to say thanks!
Welcome to Evelyn's...!
No, no, no...! This is a DISASTER!
Don't worry, I'm fine. It's not as bad as it looks.
No, that syrup was the key to my pancake recipe, and there's no way I can make more before the event!
Relax, it's only syrup! Here, I'll help clean up...<delay 500> Mmm,<delay 500> is this lavender? <delay 500>It tastes AMAZING!
'Tasted', you mean. It's ruined now!
How much could one jar cost? Actually, I'm a little tight on cash right now, but I could-
Look, just... leave. Please, before the whole place collapses.
People will be here any minute, and we have nothing they could vote for.
Hey, we still have some time! Why don't I help you make more syrup?
It's no use... I'm all out of lavender, and it's too late to go get more...

Emily, dear, you did everything you could...
We can try again next year.
You were right, Em, that fortune-telling thing was total B.S. - I should've foreseen this!
...Preferably before buying three dozen boxes of tea.
Please, enough about tea...
.<delay 200>.<delay 200>.<delay 200>
.<delay 200>.<delay 200>.<delay 200>

Wait - <delay 500>Frank, you're a genius!
I think I've got the answer!
Okay, the new tea syrup is ready. I just hope it's good...
Otherwise, all those people outside will be pretty disappointed when we cancel the event.
Emily... It's delicious!
Best pancakes this place has ever served - no offense, Evelyn.
Phew! <delay 500>And thanks to Frank's impulsive spending habits, we can make more than one batch!
It's almost funny how you spent all night trying to find the perfect recipe while that cup of tea was right in front of you...
Yeah - almost.
Well then, girls, how about we open up and turn this event into a real PARTY?
Okay, voting has just closed and the results are in! Let's see... Lobster Paradise got first place again. No surprise there.
Oh, but look!<delay 250> "Evelyn's Place - Special-Tea Pancakes." We made it into the top ten!
Emily, you're gonna completely freak out! Look at this...
Yeah, I know. <delay 250>I just got off the phone with the owner of Lobster Paradise.
Apparently he was here earlier, and he was so impressed he offered me a stagiaire at his restaurant.
Emily, this is great! Sure, staging is unpaid... and temporary... But it's how all great chefs get started.
But what about you and dad?<delay 500> The diner is gonna be way more crowded now that we've made the list!
Don't worry, we've been running this place for a long time, dear. I think we'll manage.
I don't know, Mom...<delay 500> I don't think I'm ready yet...
Don't be silly - look at how much you've accomplished! Even I had doubts about this event, and now we have our own dish on the list.
You have to find your own path, Emily. Opportunities like these... Well, believe me, they don't come along very often.

Wow, everything is so fancy...
so clean...
And everyone looks so professional...
Yeah, put those flowers right there - they really brighten up the room.
No way... HE'S the owner?

I wish I could've been there for Emily's first day!
I hope her "culinary heaven" is as perfect as she imagined!
What's that, Evelyn? What are you reading?

The mailman just dropped this off...
Who sends a scented letter nowadays?
...From J-Jean Paul?

That's a great chance to practice my pancake recipe!

Room2_Text.text: Lobster's Paradise
It's... you?  <delay 250>I had no idea you owned the Lobster Paradise, sir! The other day, I didn't...
What? Oh, riiiight. Bet you wish you hadn't yelled at me about that syrup now, don't you?
Ah, you must be Emily Napoli! I'm Mr. Paradise, the owner of this restaurant... And I see you already met Patrick, our flower delivery boy.
Come on, we're losing daylight here. Don't think you can slack off just because you're a stagiaire! Off to your station, chop-chop!
Finally, a moment's rest... The pace here is UNBELIEVABLE!
Don't get used to it - I don't see the other cooks here taking breaks.
Oh, you. So... you're not the owner of this place.
Well, I don't like to be defined by what I'm not, but...
What do you even do around here?
You know me - always looking for new restaurants to ruin.
It's nice to see you two getting along so well! Tell you what - you can receive our flower deliveries each morning, help Patrick out.
But, sir... shouldn't I focus on my cooking? I don't really know much about flowers, either...
Lobsters are noble creatures, Napoli, and they demand noble flower arrangements. It's an EXTREMELY important job.
WHAT? A letter from Jean-Paul?! Emily's long lost love?!

It's been years since they last saw each other.
What could he possibly want from her now?
Maybe he wants to see her again, rekindle the old flame. Hey, I might not be that bad at fortune-telling after all!
If that's true... Then we've got no choice. We should throw the letter away before Emily sees it.
Why would we do that?!
When she couldn't contact Jean-Paul, Emily almost gave everything up to go back to Paris... I'm not putting her through that again just because now he-
Wait, Evelyn, look at the date on the postmark - this letter was sent YEARS ago!
You're right, it's from back then! In that case, maybe I should just open it first and see...
Don't even think about it - this is Emily's PRIVATE business. I'm gonna keep it for her so she can decide.
Okay, okay... What kind of mother wants to read her daughter's private letters, anyway?
Napoli! A customer just returned this dish, and my sous chef says it's "the stagiaire's fault".
Wait, that's not true! That isn't even from my station!
Ah, I thought so...  <delay 250>It's a shame, but I've already gave him a second chance<delay 250> - he's fired!
He's WHAT? No, no, I... Come to think of it, maybe I did help him out with that one.
Hmm... <delay 250>If that were true, you'd only get one more chance - mess up again and you're out. Are you SURE it's your fault?
...Yes. Yes, I'm sure. I forgot, but it was my fault after all.

Napoli, there are two types of lobsters -<delay 250> big ones, and food for the big ones. 
If I were you, I'd try to grow fast.
Oh, so you finally decided to show up. How gracious of you!
Relax... I'm only, like, five minutes late. Do you always get so worked up?
Only when I get up early to open for you, and you arrive fifty - not five, fifty - minutes late!
Look, you don't get it. Maybe this is just some dumb job to you, an easy way to save up for gas money or something silly like that...
Hey! Saving up for a trip across Europe is NOT silly! Me, my bike, the open road...
That's nice and everything, but this is the kind of job I've been waiting for my whole life. I NEED it to go well!
Jeez, okay, I promise it won't happen again... but there's more to life than work, ya know?
That letter... it would only cause Emily more heartbreak.
Hold your horses, cowboy!
What? Oh, no, I was just trying to ID the stamp... You know, for my 'Intro to Philately' course!
Yes, that definitely looks like Napoleon, wouldn't you say?
Oh, don't even, you little sneak. I caught you red-handed!
Alright, alright! It was just too tempting... Wait, why were YOU sneaking around in here...?
I can sneak around my diner whenever I want... and I won't let some handsome Parisian devil hurt my daughter again!
You know, that's a VERY good point! We should open this letter - not for us, of course, but for Emily's sake.
For Emily's sake.
Frank... You need to find Emily and show her this letter right away!
I know, I'm sorry, it happened again! I didn't get much sleep last night, if you know what I mean...
You stayed up all night playing videogames with your friends?
...Ah, unfortunately you knew EXACTLY what I meant.
Well, Mr. Paradise will be here in ten minutes - if things aren't ready he'll think we're disrespecting his lobsters.
Ten minutes? Not a problem, that's plenty of time. I can handle it.

No way, I'm helping.
Is this the right fertilizer?
Wait, Emily, that's way too heavy, you don't need to-
Oh no, my clothes...!
Napoli, what are you doing? Your shift is about to start.
You must tend to your uniform just as a lobster tends to its shell. Remember, you're already on thin ice.
EMILY! You won't believe this. A lost letter was delivered and<delay 300>.<delay 300>.<delay 300>.
Well, you should just take a look.
Why is it open? You better have a good excuse...
Wait -<delay 250> "FROM JEAN-PAUL"?!
"Dear Emily, You never told me your address, but I've run out of options. I tried absolutely everything I could to contact you..."
Oh no... Maybe he DID try to contact me after all, he just had the wrong number!
He must have thought you gave him a fake number, then - look!
"Maybe you didn't feel the same, but I can't get over that magical summer we shared."
"If you felt it too, I know this letter will find you somehow, someday. I will wait for you forever. Love, Jean-Paul."
This is the most romantic thing I've EVER heard!!
To think I doubted Jean-Paul... But what can I do now? The return address must be useless after all these years.
Nothing a quick internet search can't solve...
Wait, what?!
"Awarded with a prestigious Michelin star, Chef Jean-Paul Fontaine emerges as one of the most promising chefs in French cuisine."

Chef Jean-Paul?
<delay 250>MY Jean-Paul?
"Since opening his restaurant in Paris, this vibrant culinary artist has become a celebrity - his life a whirlwind of cameras and stoves."
He was such an amazing cook, even back then, but I never imagined he'd be so famous by now!
Paris... The City of Love, cradle of the Nouvelle Cuisine... We have to find a way to get in touch with him!
No monsieur, I'm not a fan, I'm his... I-I'm a friend of his. Listen, I really need to speak with Jean-Paul...
Yes, I understand Mr. Fontaine is very busy, and that he receives lots of calls, but if you just tell him who it is, he'll really want to-
No, I'm not interested in booking a table eighteen months from now. I need to talk with him ASAP! ...Hello?
Uh!?<delay 250> Hello?
*Beep, Beep, Beep*
Well, his assistant just hung up on me. I've tried email, snail mail, social media... Nothing. That's it, I give up!
There's got to be another way... Maybe we could find his house on Google Maps, and-
Enough, Frank. Yes, we could've had something amazing, but I think our moment has passed...
It just wasn't meant to be. ...That's life, I guess.
Emily - these signs, they can't all be coincidences. This is fate!
The stars are almost aligned. I'll just find a way to nudge them into place!
Sorry, sorry! I know I'm late, I was on the phone...
My, how the tables have turned. You show up late, you bring your boyfriend to work...
My boyfriend? ...Oh, you mean Frank!  Believe me, I'm not his type... or any other girl, for that matter.
What? Oh, I just thought... Uh, not that I care what you do outside of work-
And get off that high horse - you've been late so many times, I could do this all by myself!
Actually, you might have to - for a while, anyway. I'm leaving tonight - it's finally time for my trip across Europe!
Already? I didn't know you had saved up enough... So, I guess you'll be quitting this job.
Why? The whole reason I'm traveling is to see all the beautiful gardens around Europe - Boboli, Keukenhof, Versailles...
Wait, you actually LIKE your job? I thought it was just a way for you to make money!
I mean, sure, someday I'd like to design gardens myself, but for now this is close enough. Why? Do you think that's weird?
No, no... <delay 250>I'm just happy you finally get to go on your trip. Now, we'd better get started, or I'll be the one out of a job by the time you're back.
Mr. Paradise!
The Hendersons have a reservation for six people, but they want to add a couple more.
We have our claws full as it is... How many more diners are we talking about?
...Fifteen. <delay 250>But their family came all the way from Glasgow as a surprise!
Napoli, we won't be able to offer excellent service to them OR anyone else if we bite off more than we can chew. Do you understand?
But it's their Nana's ninetieth birthday AND a family reunion...!
Please, I'll work extra hard to cover their table!
Fine, that's enough - but you're responsible if anything goes wrong.
Last chance, Napoli - it's time to find out if you're a big lobster or a little crayfish.
Oh, God... What did I just do...?

Emily? I was just dropping by to say good- <delay 250>
What's going on here?
Oh, nothing, everything's peachy! <delay 250> <i>Except that I'm stupid and I agreed to do something impossible, and I'm gonna get fired, and-
Hey, hey, calm down... Why don't I stay and lend you a hand?
You'd really do that?<delay 300> Wait, weren't you going to Europe tonight?

Actually, they changed my flight time - I'm leaving tomorrow.
Airlines ,right?
Really, you're going to help me? Although if you don't know how to cook...
I'm painfully aware of that, but lucky for you, I know how to do the dishes. Come on, the sooner we start the better!

Oh, thank you, Patrick!
And thank you, overbooking!
Hi, I was wondering if I could change my flight... Yes, I know it's leaving tonight, but...

I must say, I'm impressed, Napoli.
I didn't have you pegged as a risk-taker.
I've got an open position for an assistant here - it's yours if you want it. It makes no sense to keep a big lobster as a mere stagiaire!
I-I can't believe it. Thank you so much, sir! I will NOT let you down!
That's great, Emily. You deserve-
Emily, look at this! They're about to start shooting a big-budget competitive cooking show called "Rising Chef" in Paris.
And the judge will be none other than - get this - celebrity chef Jean-Paul! You NEED to go!
What, all the way to Paris? That's ridiculous! It's not like I can just quit everything... And how would I even get on the show...?
That's the thing - they're holding auditions for two weeks in Paris. It's the only way for you to see Jean-Paul again!
Uh... Paris? Jean-Paul? Emily, what's going on?
Emily, you're not seriously considering quitting to audition for some French cooking show, are you?
Well, not really, it's just... There's history between us. It was a long time ago, but he did say he'd wait for me...
Wake up, Emily! We say all kinds of crap when we're kids - he's probably forgotten all about you by now!
Okay, first of all, you don't know ANYTHING about Jean-Paul! Someone like you wouldn't understand, but he's romantic, mature...
...and probably married by now. Besides, you have other things going on, like this new job - which I helped you get, by the way!
Come on, you just helped because your flight was canceled. That doesn't make up for the thousands of times you got me in trouble!
Oh, really?<delay 250> Well, I-<delay 250>I...<delay 250> And who did you think told Mr. Paradise about your pancakes in the first place?
I just can't believe you would give up such a good opportunity over a... a childish crush!
You really think I'm the childish one here? Being on a TV show like this one would be an amazing opportunity.
You know what? Thanks Patrick. You've helped me make up my mind - I'm going to Paris!

I couldn't sleep all night...
Ugh, that Patrick is such a pain in the neck. ...Hey, I'm not making a mistake, am I?
Of course not! True love doesn't just fall on people's laps. How did Mr. Paradise take it?
He just said there's a day in every lobster's life when it must shed its shell and find a bigger one... So I guess he's okay with it?

I hope Mom and Dad don't get mad.
I left a note, but...
They'll be fine. Evelyn was even more thrilled than I was after reading that letter.
Thanks, Frank - I wouldn't be following my heart if it weren't for you.
Just call me the moment you get there, okay?
And remember, if you get in trouble I know some basic French from my "Doing Business with Canadians" course.
How could I forget? You spent a whole year trying to get people to call you "François".
I'm coming, Jean-Paul... Your wait will finally be over!
JEAN-PAUL? Is that you?
LAST CALL! LAST CALL! FLIGHT ABOUT TO TAKE OFF-
Oh, no... I fell asleep! MY FLIGHT!
Please, sir! I can't miss this flight!
I'm sorry, the flight is closed...
Please, I have to get on - it's my only chance to find true love! Give me a second, I've got my ticket here somewhere...
Your true love? My brother left everything to follow his dreams, too. Okay, HURRY - the plane is just about to take off!
Oh, thank you so much, I won't forget this. Paris, here I come!
I wonder if my brother ever got that job, I should really give him a call...
Wait - did she say Paris?

Room3_Text.text: Milano Trattoria
Come on, Emily. Sure, you've got no phone, no luggage, no way to get to Paris... But I'm sure you can find a way to make money around here.
Alessa, PRESTO! I'm swamped in the kitchen again, we have to hire that assistant I'm always asking for!
Carlo, my friend, if you didn't turn down everyone who applies, you'd have an assistant!
Scusi... I heard you need an assistant? I just flew in from the States and I know how to cook...
That a fact?<delay 250> Tell me, then, how would you prepare a kiwi panna-cotta?
Well, I wouldn't,<delay 250> since kiwi stops gelatin from solidifying - unless you cook it first, of course.
I can already tell by the look on Carlo's face - you better get to work IMMEDIATELY!
...So when I woke up, I rushed to the gate and somehow I got on the wrong plane. Of course, my suitcase and my phone were sent to Paris...
Oh, you poor bambina, what a mess! If I were you, I would've demanded a flight to Paris immediately!
And knowing Alessandra, she probably would've gotten a first class seat!
I tried, but tickets are ridiculously expensive on such short notice, and the rest of my money was in my suitcase.
What a bunch of... Never trust someone in uniform, I tell you! These canaglie, pezzo di...
When he gets like this... Well, let's just say it's a good thing you don't understand Italian.
Anyway, thank you so much for the room and the job. I don't know how I'd get to Paris on time without your help!
We should be thanking you. As you can see, Carlo has been unusually cheery since you arrived - so please, stay as long as you want.
Thanks, but there's something VERY important happening in Paris in two weeks, and I need to be there.
Hello? Mom?
Emily! I've been trying to call you. Is everything okay? Did you get to Paris safely?
Oh... Er, Paris... Yes! It's as beautiful as I remembered!
I'm sorry I couldn't call sooner. My phone got stolen at Charles de Gaulle airport...
Oh, dear! These things always seem to happen to you. So... did you get an audition? Did you see Jean-Paul?!
Er... Not yet... Actually, I need to go, Mom - I've got to practice. Tell Dad I miss him, and tell Frank I'm doing magnifiquement!
Emily, cara mia, wouldn't it be easier to tell them what happened? I'm sure they'd send you money.
I know, I just don't want to worry them, especially after leaving so quickly. I couldn't even make it to Paris...
Well, we have our hands full in the kitchen, so I'm not gonna complain.
That's a first!
Carlo, I need three more macaroni for table two!
Madonna Santa, more macaroni? We're almost out! Do people stop reading after the first dish on the menu or what?
Ah, leave it to me. I'm sure deep down they actually wanted to order... I don't know, some focaccia?
That would be much better. Focaccia bread, I have plenty of.
But how will you...?
No one says "no" to Alessandra - she could talk someone into taking ice cubes to the North Pole if she wanted to.
Please, as long as our food has the "Carlo touch", I can talk anyone into ordering anything.
Wow... It's pretty impressive how well you two get along. You make a great team.
We've been friends since forever. Sometimes it's like she's the other half of my brain.
Emily, we've seen you moping around enough to think you might be interested in joining our notte di lamenti.
Your what?
Alessandra and I, we're still looking for our Mister and Miss Right - but we have a little ritual to help us get by.
We open up a big bottle of wine and laugh about what a disaster our most recent date has been.
Exactly - <delay 250>like this girl I went out with last night. She thought I was just the cutest...
So cute, in fact, that I was her "wittle big boy". She even tried to feed me a choo-choo train of soup...
Well, she DID write "strong maternal instinct" on her profile - so really, you brought this upon yourself.
Anyway, my date didn't baby talk, he just talked too much. I ended up paying the waiter to spill a drink on me, just so I had an excuse to leave.
Come on, he couldn't have been that bad!
Actually, the waiter was sexy - and I'd rather have him throw hot coffee in my face than sit through one more minute of Mr. Blabbermouth.
Thanks, I needed that... To be honest, I used to think looking for true love was silly, but now...
It's actually the reason I'm going to Paris.
To Emily. May she find her true love in Paris!
You must be starving, Emily. I brought you a special treat, try it out.
What's this? I've never seen it on the menu...
Carlo's little secret - he likes to cook some avant-garde cuisine on the side. Come on, tell me what you think!
Finally! They're like a pack of starving jackals out there... Hey, what are you eating!?

Carlo... This is SO good!
You should definitely include this in the menu.
What?! Oh, no, impossibile! We can't serve this in a trattoria, it's not that kind of place.
There's more to the world than this little trattoria, Carlo. If cooking this kind of food makes you happy, then do it!
Maybe someday...
Promise me something, then - even if you become a celebrity, you'll always have a table reserved for me!
Ma che cosa... This is incredible...
What is it, Carlo?
After our conversation, I applied to be the head chef at a new avant-garde restaurant, and they offered me the job.
WHAT!? That's wonderful! This is your dream job, isn't it?
Why aren't you jumping for joy? Is there a catch?
No, no... They've offered me complete creative freedom. On paper, it seems like the perfect opportunity...
...An opportunity I'm going to turn down.
What?!<delay 250>But WHY?
I don't get it... Why would you pass this up? Head chef at a hip, cutting edge restaurant - it's your dream job!
Well, when you really think about it, it's not that good an opportunity. It's far away, and the weather is much colder over there...
It's just on the other side of Milan.
Yes, but the traffic! And the trattoria, I'd miss it too much...
That's a surprise! Ever since I arrived I've heard you complain about everything here except Alessandra!

Wait... <delay 250>Oh my god, that's it!
You're in love with Alessandra!

Alessa?<delay 250> No, we're just friends.
 Sure, I like how her eyes sparkle when she smiles, and how I'm happy just being around her, and...
Santa Madonna... I DO LOVE HER!!
How could I have been so blind? It's Alessandra! That's why I keep sabotaging my dates - I don't want to be with anyone else.
And that's why you don't want to leave, to stay close to her. Carlo, you need to talk to Alessandra.
But she's my best friend! Why would I risk that?
Because you love her! And maybe there's a chance she loves you back...
I don't think she does, I know her too well. No, it's better if I don't say anything.
But you'll regret it forever if you don't. In my experience, when it comes to love, it's better not to make any assumptions.
Okay, okay! I'll tell her on our next notte di lamenti. But please, you need to be there too... just in case.
Emily, you'll be at our next notte, right?
Sure! I have a feeling this one will be particularly memorable.
You think so? Carlo was acting a bit strange... Maybe he has one of his hilarious lamenti to share.
He might have something up his sleeve, yes...
Oh, remember that sexy waiter? I'm seeing him again tonight! I hope this doesn't turn into another story...
Why is it so hard to find someone passionate, but sensible? Clever and talented, but not pretentious? I don't ask for much, do I?
You'll find him - you're closer than you think.
That's sweet, Emily, but forgive me if I don't hold my breath.
Okay, Carlo, I'm here for you - although if it looks like things are going well, I'll slip out to give you two some privacy.
Alessa, before we start, there's something I wanted to tell you...
Wait, this time I need to go first. It seems Cupid finally got off his lazy butt and started helping out!
Oh? <delay 800>What do you...? <delay 250>I mean, <delay 250>really?
Something finally went right! That waiter from the other day was so nice. It was a perfect date - we hit it off immediately.
I don't want to jinx it, and it's way too early to tell, but... This could actually be going somewhere.
Whoa, I'm... <delay 500>very happy for you. <delay 500>You deserve it...
What about you, what did you want to say earlier? Did you have a good story to tell?
I... <delay 500>Yes, about that... <delay 500>Well, it's nothing, really... <delay 500>Um...
It was me! <delay 250>I had a horrible date with a guy who just wouldn't stop talking about lobsters. "The world is my lobster!" Right, Carlo?
<delay 200>.<delay 200>.<delay 200>.Yeah, that was it...
Oh, Emily! We had a new guest check in today, an American like you. He's young, BELLISSIMO - instant swipe-right.
Alessandra! Weren't you excited about this new relationship of yours?
I am. You, on the other hand, are still on your quest for love, so...
I may have accidentally given him the room right next to yours! Who knows, you might find true love before you even get to Paris.
Vrooom, vroooom!
Look, I think he just got back!
Oh, no... Oh God, no... It can't be...!
Emily? What the hell are you doing here?!
How does someone board the wrong plane? I mean, how does that even happen?!
Alright, ha-ha, it's hilarious, we get it. What are YOU doing here, anyway?
Hey, unlike you, I came here on purpose. Milan was on my route - so many great gardens in the area!
Well, I'm already staying here, so...
So? I'm sorry, princess, but I had a room reserved AND paid for already - I'm not going anywhere.
...Fine! I'm leaving tomorrow anyway, I guess we can just ignore each other until then.
Yes, I will somehow resist the urge to spend time in your delightful company.
So... you spent some time with the americano, have you? Was there a spark?
Oh, sparks flew, all right. Thankfully it doesn't matter - tonight's my last night here.
What? You're leaving already?
I've saved up enough for another flight, and I really need to be in Paris before the audition period ends in three days.
Oh, Emily, we'll miss you so much - but we'll manage, right Carlo?
Actually... I'm leaving too. I just accepted a position as head chef at the Osteria Benedettino.
That avant-garde place? <delay 250>Oh, I see...
I guess now I know what years of friendship mean to you - assolutamente niente!
I don't think that went very well.
You TOOK the job, then?
What was I supposed to do? She's finally found someone - I don't want to get in the way of that.
So that's it? You're just going to give up?
Emily... Things might be different if I had realized sooner, but now... It's just too late.
Timing is everything, isn't it?
Promise me one thing: you can never tell Alessandra.
I still want her to think of me as a friend... once she forgives me for leaving.
Ah, it's so easy to pack when you don't have a suitcase! Now it's finally time for a nice, relaxing shower and-
Aaargh! Cold, COLD!
Emily? Whoa, either these walls are too thin or you're way too loud... probably both.
Patrick!! Weren't you listening when they told us they only have a SMALL water heater? You used up all the hot water!
Oh, that's a shame - my Hollywood shower felt SO good! Now, if you'll excuse me, I'm in the middle of a game so...
Yeah, about that - I couldn't watch my movie earlier because SOMEONE was hogging the WiFi!
And why should I quit my game just so you can watch some dumb chick flick?
Oh, I'm sorry, are you the one who had to take a FREEZING shower?
Fine, fine. Not like I can concentrate while you're yelling at me, anyway... Guess I'll do something else!
"There is a house in New Orleans... They call the Rising Sun... And it's been the ruin of many..."
Patrick!! My movie already has a soundtrack, and it's actually got good guitars!
Okay, you win! I'm getting another room!!
Please, tell me you're here to move your things to your new room!
I wish! I just waited at the reception for twenty minutes but nobody came - can you believe it?
You're supposed to ring the bell on the table, you know.
I did! But I doubt the manager heard me over her own yelling.
Sounded like she was having a heated argument with that boyfriend of hers.
Alessandra? But I thought things were going well with the waiter...
I don't know about that. She kept shouting that other guy's name - Carlo, was it?
Carlo? <delay 250>...You know, you might be onto something. I think I should go talk to her!
And don't forget to tell her I want a new room! I'll just be inside... tucked in bed... But just until she's sorted everything out!
Alessandra, here you are... Listen, it's about Carlo-
Uffa! I don't want to hear another word about Carlo! If he wants to leave, then good riddance!
But he's your friend, shouldn't you be happy for him? After all, you're the one who encouraged him to focus on avant-garde cuisine...
I did, but when I imagine the Trattoria without his grumpy remarks and his keen wit... Well, it just won't be the same.
Alessandra, could it be that you feel something else for him? Something romantic?
I... Oh, Emily... <delay 250>Please, promise you won't tell him. I don't want to get in the way of his new job!
But Alessandra!
Please, Emily! It's my fault - I didn't realize I was in love with him until it was too late. It's just terrible timing.
Okay, I can keep a secret...<delay 250> two, even.
Frank? It's great to hear your voice, but... how did you get this number?
Evelyn gave it to me! She told me your phone was stolen and I got worried, so...
I'M IN PARIS!
WHAT!?
Well, I thought - Emily's in Paris all alone, with no phone and no friends, looking for true love in a thrilling cooking contest...
...So what in the world am I doing in Snuggford?
Er... I kinda have to tell you something. I'm... technically not in Paris.
WHAAAT?! Where are you... "technically"?
It doesn't matter - I'm about to get a ticket, so I'll be there in a few hours. I'll explain everything when I'm there.
But before I leave, I need to fix something here...
Listen, Carlo, since we're both leaving - why not have one last notte?
Ah, I thought I heard some noises coming from your room last night. You must have something to tell us...
What? No! That was something else. Please, I really need to talk to you both before I leave!
I don't know... Alessandra's been avoiding me ever since I said I was leaving, so don't be surprised if it's just you and me.
Alessandra! I was just about to come find you - I'm leaving today, but before I do, I need an emergency notte!
Oh, I know what this is about - I heard the sounds coming from the americano's room...
It's not that! Seriously, what's wrong with you people... I'll tell you later, okay?
Alright...<delay 250> Although, the way I've been treating Carlo, I doubt he'll want to join us.
No trace of Emily, and her room's been cleared out too. She just left this note...
"I'm really sorry, but I had to leave early. It's bad timing - I wish I could've said goodbye when I had the chance."
That's strange... She looked so eager to have a final notte. I suppose there's no need for it now.
Actually, if this is our last notte... I have one lamento to express.
You see, I realized I was madly in love with a girl just before she fell for someone else.
So, of course, I did the only thing I could think of - I quit my job. I ran away from her.
You know, I think I have one too. I met this nice guy, but then... I realized I was already in love with someone else.
Really? This "someone else"... he must be quite the guy.
Not really. <delay 250>He's a bit grouchy, and his love life is a disaster... Though he IS the most talented chef I've ever met.
Your girl, though... she must be incredible, making you want to leave everything behind.

Well, she's a bit of a smart-ass, but she's funny...
And the prettiest woman in Milano.
Carlo, do you think that, for once, our notte could end without lamenti?
In the end, the only thing I could do was set up a "notte" and hope they figure it out themselves.
Very touching. We have a soft spot for sentimental stuff in my family, ma'am, but I don't have all day. What do you want?
Fine, I want your next flight to Paris- wait, I knew you looked familiar! I met your twin brother, he told me all about your dream!
Do I look like I followed my dream? He was probably talking about my other brother. The three of us haven't spoken in years...
But YOU are about to achieve your dream of going to Paris... with flight 9750. It leaves in just three days!
Wait, three days?! B-but the final day of auditions is in just two!
Ma'am, there's an air controllers' strike, it's all over the papers... On top of that, Paris is our hottest destination.
Look again, please - there's got to be something!
Well... It looks like there IS a seat available! Flight 9860 arrives in Paris two days from now, but you'll have to board in Zurich tomorrow morning.
Zurich?! It's not that far, but... Argh! I guess that'll have to do. Thank you!
And next time don't wait until the last minute to book your flight!
To think you might have left before we told each other how we really felt.
If it weren't for Emily calling that notte... We probably would have missed our chance!
That girl... she really is something. I doubt we'll ever see her again, but I'll be eternally-
Emily, you came back! What happened?
You'll never believe it, Emily - Alessandra loves me, too!
It was about time you finally talked to each other! I'm so happy for you guys!
Thanks! We've got everything planned - Carlo will stay here, and we'll find a way to work some molecular gastronomy into the menu.
Our customers, they'll learn to appreciate 21st Century cuisine... even if I have to drag them kicking and screaming.
Will you still need an assistant? Because if I can't find a taxi to Zurich soon, I might be staying for a while...
Yes, a taxi to Zurich... Leaving from Milan... Yes, I know it's far, but-
WHY DOES EVERYBODY HANG UP ON ME?!
It might be your yelling. Makes me glad I'm taking off... The beautiful gardens of Switzerland await me.
Wait a minute, americano... did you say Switzerland?
Stop right there, Alessandra. Don't you dare get any ideas...
Why, if I remember Patrick's route correctly, he's driving right past Zurich's airport!
Oh, no... Yesterday she called me a %!&$#%& and now I'm supposed to be her chauffeur?
For once we agree - I'd sooner walk to Zurich than ride with him!
Are you two still in kindergarten? This is obviously the perfect solution - end of discussion!
Okay, okay... to the airport and then we're done! One rule, though - no talking on the road!
Fine! It's not like I have anything to say to you either...
Nobody says no to Alessa!
Yeah... you'd better get used to it!
Patrick! Don't take the next right, the road's closed!
Didn't we say 'no talking'? I can't even hear what you're saying back there!
I said 'the road's closed'! Excuse me if I don't want our trip to get cut short by your rule to 'NOT TALK'!
What's that? A SHORTCUT? Fine, whatever, we'll take it if you want!
No, Patrick...!
Focaccia
Cheese
Balsamic vinegar
Focaccia oven
Pasta
Basil and olives
Tomato sauce
Pasta pots
Sauce pot
Panna cotta
Fridge
Aperitif
Aperitif bottle
Tray
Plants
Counter cloths
Curtains
Chairs
Tables
Counter

Room4_Text.text: Confiserie Godot
To think that, of all the good times Lucy and I shared together, a ride with you might be our last...!
Gee, if only someone had warned you about the closed road!
And also, 'Lucy'? Seriously? Just when I thought I couldn't respect you any less...
Relax, maybe I can still fix her - your flight doesn't leave until tomorrow anyhow...
I'm going to ask around. Zurich isn't that far, maybe someone else can take me to the airport.
Ow! I'm so, SO sorry - are you okay? God, you're such a klutz, Liliana...!
I mean, um... Welcome to Confiserie Godot! Can I help you with... um, anything? We're a little busy at the moment...
Actually, I was just looking for a way to get to Zurich - our motorcycle broke down, so...
Oh, my parents can totally take you there! They're out making a couple of deliveries, but they should be back any second now... <delay 250>I hope!
Really? Oh, that's great! I'll go tell Patrick - he's the guy I came with!
Sure. Now, if you'll excuse me, I REALLY need to get back to work - it's so hectic here without Mom and Dad!
Hey, Liliana? You look like you could use a hand and I need to wait for your parents anyway, so... can I help?
Emily, that was amazing, you picked everything up so fast - you should, like, do this for a living.
Well, I actually DO - I'm a chef, though I had never seen sweets like these!
Now I know why this place is so crowded, even in the middle of a blizzard.
People come from all over the country to try Godot's chocolates. Mom says the secret ingredient is in our genes...
But honestly, it's not like there's a lot of interesting stuff to do around here anyway...
Speaking of uninteresting things... How's your bike looking, Patrick?
Wow... so THAT'S Patrick?

So you're from the States, Patrick?
That's SO interesting...!
I'm from the States too -<delay 500> just like three hundred million other people. It's not that special, really.
And this European tour... So exciting! I love to travel, too - I go to the next town over at least once a month. It's got a mall!
Anyway, since you're here, does that mean you fixed your motorcycle?
Not yet. I didn't want to leave Lucy alone, but it was too cold out there. It's good to feel my toes again...
Aw, that's so kind of you! You can tell her to come inside too!
Lucy is the name of his bike. It's not a real person.
Oh, got it. Well, you can park her inside our garage, I'm sure she'll be more comfortable there!
That'd be great! If I can borrow your tools I might even be able to get her back on the road.

Good news!
I fixed the brakes.
Wow, that's impressive! We barely have any tools in our garage!
Well, I learned a lot about bike repair on this trip. Lucy had some brake issues in Vienna...
Turns out all I needed to fix her was a little duct tape!
What!? Lucy - I mean, that bike of yours - has been held together with duct tape all this time??
That's so clever! I'm sure it was the beautiful city of Vienna that inspired you!
Yeah, and its free WiFi connection - that's how I saw the tutorial on how to do it. Onto the engine now!
Emily!! You didn't tell me you had such a HOT boyfriend! Oh, it'd be so nice to have adventures like yours someday...
What? Oh no, we're not together, not even close. He's just my ride to Zurich.
Really? Hm.<delay 300>.<delay 300>.<delay 300> Well, don't worry - my parents will get you there for sure!
I feel like this day has lasted forever!
Tell me about it... When I woke up in Milan this morning, I was sure I'd be in Paris by now, auditioning...
Right, "auditioning" - is that what the kids call it nowadays? 'Oh, Jean-Pierre! Tell me, was that good for you? Or was it too... salty?'
It's Jean-Paul and you know it! Anyway, you're right, clearly I would be lucky to have what you share with Lucy...
Um... That was my dad on the phone, he says the only road to Zurich is closed because of the snowstorm.
I know your flight leaves early in the morning, so there's still some time, but it might be a while before they're back.
I really can't catch a break, can I? Well, as you said, there's still time - nothing to do but wait, then.
Emily, that's... surprisingly zen of you.
Oh, you know... I'm learning.
Mmm, Liliana, I'd literally kill for your chocolates - these are soooo good.
You think so? I, um... I was thinking about giving some to Patrick... You think he'd like them too?
Patrick? Oh please, don't waste such sweet, sweet perfection on him!
Okay, I'm calling it. I need an actual mechanic to fix Lucy.
Liliana, look at all these orders. There's a HUGE one from Helvetia due tomorrow.
Oh, um... I was waiting for my parents to come back and deal with all this boring shop stuff...
Well, I better get back to Lucy. It seems like you've got your hands full...
Stop right there!
You JUST said you needed a mechanic! Make yourself useful and give us a hand.
I'm telling you girls, I'm so good at this I'm even surprising myself.
Patrick... The chocolates are supposed to say "Helvetia," not "Helvetica." You had ONE job!
What?! Crap, now I have to start all over...
Patrick, "Helvetica" sounds so much cooler! You're a genius!
Right? And why do all the chocolates need to say "Helvetia", anyway?
Oh, we get orders like this all the time. It must be some fancy hotel, or a cruise ship...
Well, whatever it's for, they're not gonna be happy if we don't finish it in time, so let's get back to it!
You know, this actually looks pretty good, Patrick...
Taste may be your department, but looks... it's not that different from garden design, really.
Listen, I'm sorry about earlier. <delay 250>You're stuck here too, when you should be driving around Europe, enjoying your fascinating gardens.
The snowstorm would've caught me either way. At least I've got some company - not the best, but what can you do?
Jean-Paul et le célèbre chef Kali Pandey ont été vus ensemble lors de l'événement...
Wait, what was that? Hey, Liliana, what are they talking about?
It's that handsome French chef, Jean-Paul - do you know him? There was a rumor a few days ago that he's dating Kali Pandey.
They make such a CUTE couple! Oh, Kali is THE best! She's, like, the greatest chef ever. She's totally my role model!
I... I'm sorry, I think I need some air.
Mind if I join you? I enjoy brooding too.
I'm not brooding! I'm just keeping an eye out for Liliana's parents.
Hey, those showbiz rumors are never true. You know that, right? They're just click-bait for lame gossip sites...
...I don't know, Patrick. Even if it isn't true, I haven't heard from Jean-Paul for years. Anything could've happened in that time.
It was stupid to think he would wait for me - you said so yourself. God, I'm such an idiot!
I did say that, but... I don't think it's a bad thing. It's a brave kind of stupid.
...Thanks, Patrick.
Besides, what does it matter if it's true? You're still gonna win the hell outta that show!
Now let's get back inside. You can brood for longer if you're not frozen to death, you know?
Emily, you won't believe it - I'm going to be a stagiare at Le Compteur d'Etoiles!
Jean-Paul, that's amazing! How did you do it?
I got tired of waiting for their call, so I went there myself and demanded to speak with the chef.
You're unbelievable! You can charm just about anyone, can't you?
Just being able to charm you makes me the luckiest man in all of Paris...
What...? Is it morning already? Oh, no, what time is- CRAP!
What's going on? Are Liliana's folks back?
I don't know. But my flight left half an hour ago.
I'm SO sorry, I fell asleep! It looks like the roads are still closed, though. Let me call my parents and see where they are.
It doesn't matter... I already missed my flight.
Today is the last day of auditions. There's no way I'll make it in time.
Come on, don't be such a pessimist...
Well, I WOULD be on that plane right now - if only you had listened to me when I warned you about the road.
Oh, is that what you shouted? It's hard to hear someone when you're on a bike wearing a helmet - even someone as loud as you!
Your bike was running on DUCT TAPE! Were you really expecting to ride through Europe on THAT?
If I remember correctly, you were doing a mighty fine job of ruining your trip without my help!
I'm sorry, Frank... It just feels like EVERYTHING has been going against me since I left Snuggford!
But you're so close, Em! You can't give up now - I've already bought a green shirt so we match on TV! GO TEAM EMILY!
Frank, I'm not going to make it. The roads are closed, my plane is halfway to Paris by now... It's physically impossible!
Haven't you overcome SO many other obstacles already? Admittedly, they were mostly your fault, but...
No, I refuse to believe this is over! Emily - I WILL get you another chance!
Don't, Frank - I'd ruin that one too. I'll just stay here and eat delicious chocolates 'til I explode...
Okay, here's the plan - I'm gonna go get you that chance, and you're gonna bring me some of these chocolates! Deal?
I had these flowers planted upstairs, but they look withered... Do you think Patrick could take a look at them?
Liliana, they look brand new. ...Isn't that a price tag?
Um... No?
Look, if you really want to talk to Patrick, you should stop making excuses and just do it!
You think so? Dad always taught me that whether in the confiserie or in life, one misstep can ruin everything.
I still have a lot to learn about chocolates, but in life, I know you can't make things happen by waiting.
I mean, God knows why you're interested in that lazy, immature, irresponsible-
Emily, you're so right, guys like him don't come along every day. Wish me luck!
Well... I guess we all need to make our own mistakes, don't we?
Where the hell have you two been?! I've been working on the Helvetia order by myself and I've barely made a dent!
Sorry, Emily! Patrick and I started talking and well, one thing led to another, and...
I'm going to go with him and Lucy for the rest of their trip!
Oh! <delay 250>That was... <delay 250>quick, wasn't it, Patrick?
I know I'm more of a "lone wolf" kind of guy, but Lily suggested it and...
Lily, huh?
I've always wanted to travel and discover new places. Thanks, Emily - you really gave me the push I needed!
You're welcome. I'm glad everything's worked out so well...
Phew, almost done! I'll get some more hazelnuts while you finish up, Emily.
Lily's really something, huh?
You, uh... You okay, Emily? Need some help?
I'm fine. Just be careful with Liliana, will you? She's a very sweet girl.
Hey, of course I will - who do you think I am?
Jeez, you're so bitter lately. ...You know, I think you could use some sweetening up.
Patrick, what are you doing?
HEY! Real nice, Patrick. Very mature!
See, that's much better! Maybe if I keep sweetening you up, you'll even crack a smile!
You jerk... You won't be able to talk when I've filled your mouth with cream!
E-<delay 300>E-<delay 300>Emily, is that you?

Frank?
<delay 300>Why are you whispering and stuttering?

I'm hiding inside a f-<delay 300>f-<delay 300>fridge.
I'm on the TV set.
YOU'RE WHAT?!
I was sneaking in when somebody came. G-<delay 300>g-<delay 300>guess who... <delay 300>Jean-Paul and KALI P-<delay 300>P-<delay 300>PANDEY!
Great. Go on, tell me everything about their secret tryst...
NO, EM! It's a false rumor, they aren't t-<delay 500>together! Jean-Paul was just trying to get her to s-<delay 500>sponsor the show!
But she said something about a conflict of interest, and I t-<delay 300>t-<delay 300>think the director of Rising Chef wasn't too happy either.
Wow, that's...<delay 300> I mean, there's still no way I can get there on time for the audition, but...
Emily, baby, that's exactly why I'm here! Let the m-<delay 300>m-<delay 300>master work!
Frank! I was so worried! Are you safe - and at room temperature?
Safe and warm, Em! And you'll warm up too when you take a look at the contest website.
Really?
...Hey, can I borrow your laptop for a second, Liliana?
"The audition period is extended by 2 more days due to a 'kitchen malfunction." FRANK!! Was that you?!
Well, when they found me in the fridge - just as planned, of course - I introduced myself as a health inspector named François.
I don't think the security guard was actually French, because he couldn't understand my pronunciation...
But as he was escorting me out, I found a MOUSE beneath one of the ovens. They had to close the kitchen and postpone the audition!
Frank, you're the best! Thanks to you I'm still in the game. Guess I'm pretty lucky you spotted that mouse, huh?
It wasn't luck, I let it loose in the kitchen just before I hid.
Fair warning - I've gotten quite attached to the mouse. His name is now Carl!
Any luck?
Emily's looking for flights, but with the road to Zurich still closed...<delay 250> I don't know.
Has no one come to pick up the order yet?
No. Some Martin guy was supposed to pick it up, but he probably got caught in the snow.
And after all Emily did to get it ready on time...
I don't think that's what Emily's worried about right now.
Right, she must be thinking about the poor people of Helvetia! They'll have to go without our delicious chocolates...
"Helvetia"... I don't know why, but it sounds really familiar - it's been bugging me for a while now.
Here! That's it - I read about it when I was first planning my trip.
It's not a hotel or a cruise ship... it's a train! I need to find Emily - she'll be psyched!
So this Helvetia train goes to Paris?
Eventually! It's a luxury tourist train that goes around the Alps, so it takes a day and a half to get there.
But tonight it stops by a station that's kinda close-by, so if you could catch it...
...I'd get to Paris in time. Wait, how close is "kinda close-by"?
...About a three hour hike.
Three hours?! Emily, you can't do that, it's freezing outside!
Just wait for my parents to take you. They'll probably be here any minute.
Liliana, everyone has done so much to help me already - you, Frank, even Patrick.
I'm sorry, Liliana, but I don't have time to wait anymore. I'll walk.
Liliana, you're packing too? Why?
For the trip around Europe, dum-dum! I've got to start getting ready.
Listen, I was thinking - I know I still need to fix the bike, but maybe I should hit the train station first...
I mean, SOMEONE'S got to deliver that order - especially given how hard we worked on it!
...But I'll come back soon and then we're definitely going on that trip. Okay?
Sure, but I don't think I'll be here when you get back.
What do you mean?
I don't want to wait for you to come back... and I don't want to wait for you to get over her, either.
Get over who? What are you talking about?
Just go, Patrick. You're gonna miss the train and I really want those chocolates to be delivered.
And Patrick?
I really do hope you get her.
Okay, the station should't be far now.
Don't tell me we're lost! It's almost time for the train to leave...
I'm not saying we're lost - just that what I see doesn't match the map.
Wait... can you hear that?
The train's down there - just down the slope!
But it's almost at the station and we're still miles away. We'll never get there on time!
Unless...
Don't worry, Patrick, you'll get Lily's chocolates there on time - I've got an idea...
That was SO much fun, let's never do it again! ...Uh, I guess first things first, you should get your ticket while I deliver these chocolates.
Haha! Oh, I can't believe we made it! Thank you so much, Patrick!
Hello, ma'am? Hi, I REALLY need to get on this train-
I'm afraid I have to stop you right there, madame. We're at full capacity until Paris.
What?! No, no, no... This can't be happening AGAIN...
Emily, I can't find anyone to deliver these chocolates to-
Finally! You must be the American Chef Martin! And you have the famous Godot chocolates, just as I asked!
...Chef who now?
I'm Monique, the train director -it's such an honor to finally meet you! I was afraid something had happened.
Imagine, the famous Chef Martin supervising our train's luxury dining car. We've got high expectations!
Ah, then perhaps you are his wife? Of course you don't need a ticket if you're Chef Martin's wife!
Oh, no... There's been a mistake, Emily here is my-
Fiancée! We haven't set a date yet but we're really excited for the wedding. Isn't that right, darling?
Uh... Er... I... guess?

Room5_Text.text: Evelyn's Place
Come to us, Emmy!
Cheer up, Patrick...
Hey, did I tell you the last round of challenges is going to be here, in our garden!
Great, so everyone can see what a bad father I am - right here in my own home.
C'mon, now - what do they call it in footsieball? Home base advantage?
Quit calling it 'footsieball' - and it's 'home field' advantage, not 'home base'.
Same difference.
Atta girl, Emmy!
Vito's still frustrated that Emmy's doing everything first.
Don't worry - he'll learn to crawl when he needs to, right buddy?
Though once he gets like this it's almost impossible to soothe him.
Here, I learned a trick while watching him the other day.
What was that you said about home field advantage?
So, what's the first challenge?
We're not announcing it until Chad gets here.
Chad's not here?
No, apparently he missed his flight thanks to a meeting that ran late.
Hey, maybe I won't finish last after all!
Hello, everyone! I trust I didn't miss anything important, did I?
It's time, Sharon. Are you sure about this? You know what it'll mean...
Gentlemen, for your final challenge, we have something a little different for you.
Ha! Sailing, art history, horticulture, music - you name it!
We call this round of challenges - 'How Well Do You Know your Child'?
And this time... it will count as DOUBLE towards your overall scores.
WHAT?! You can't do that! Sharon...
Oh, you're not worried about a little competition, are you?
I mean... you ARE the best father in Snuggford, right?
Er... I- of course I'm not worried!
Good, then it's settled.
What do you think of the challenge?
Well... I feel pretty confident, I guess, but... so should everyone else, right?
I mean, how hard can it be to answer few questions about your kid?
Ooh... I think you'd be surprised.
Mike - your turn. Your daughter's favorite musical is... what?
Okay, okay - I know this because we were doing our theater in the park program and all the kids voted for Frozen...
...except for my Abigail, who wanted to do Annie! It's Annie!
Excellent! Now, Samuel's favorite superhero?
Peggy the Pegasus!
Correct!
Favorite dessert for both of them?
Lava fudge cake?
I'm sorry, seems that's incorrect.
Andy - what is Levi's favorite cartoon?
Oh - er... uh... okay - I know this!
He um... He seems to like Shapes n' Sizes... um... or was that Symphony Sisters?
I- I'm sorry. I guess don't know.
What's his favorite toy?
A wooden caterpillar?
I'm sorry - that's incorrect. It's a wind-up ducky.
Are you sure? I could have sworn...
Right...
I'm- I'm sorry, Mary-Lynn. You were right. I can't do this.
Sorry, everyone!
Andy, wait!
Er... Sharon, dear - don't you think the TV people have enough footage for now?
We don't want to bore our audience, do we?
Oh, come now Chad! You're the star of the show, remember?
Er... I just remembered - I have stage fright.
You gave them an hour long interview the other day.
I know! Believe me, it was excruciating.
He's got that right - I saw it on TV.
It’ll only take a few minutes, Chad. Just relax...
So Chad, all you have to do is tell us Grace's favorite popsicle flavor and we'll move on.
Oh! Well, uh... lime, of course. No - that's not right. Uh... er... grape?
Daddy, I HATE grape - it's like cough medicine!
Favorite song?
I uh... Is it the one with the singing penguins? Or were they walruses?
No daddy - it's the 'Nutcracker'! It's really fun to dance!
Favorite thing to do at the beach?
Psst! She likes to build little dams for the tide to knock down.
What?
Building DAMS!
Digging... for... clams!
Well, that wasn't exactly my finest hour, was it?
We own a house at the beach, Chad. A HOUSE.
Want us to get a bigger one? Is that it?
It's not about that!
I am NOT going to lose this contest!
Hey, these are Patrick's questions!
He's bound to know all of these...
Unless...
Unless he doesn't know which kid he's talking about... He he he...
Franklin, isn't that Reese Witherfork that just walked by?!
What? NO WAY!
She's in Snuggford filming a romantic comedy, I heard.
Reese! Wait for me!
Hmm, missing some pages... Oh well - I think I remember Patrick's questions well enough.
Patrick - name Paige's favorite animal.
Zebra!
No! It used to be a zebra but now it's a hippo!
Correct!
Favorite article of clothing?
Uh... uh... the shirt Evelyn bought her at the aquarium!
Well done - we have just one more question...
Which of these baby foods is Emmy's FAVORITE?
That's easy, plum.
Point of order! How do we know that's true? I want proof!
No problem!
Open up, girl! Time for a snack.
Here comes the spaceship, prepare for landing on Tatooine...
Nice try, ladies - but I know my own kids.
We didn't do anything...
Hey, Chad - I don't know what you were trying to pull, but that was NOT Reese Witherfork...
...and I almost got a restraining order!
How's Andy?
I couldn't find him.
I'm sure he'll be back soon - give me just a minute, okay?
Everyone - I'm happy to announce that thanks to this last challenge and some... attempted shenanigans...
...it's a four-way tie!
So thanks for coming everyone - contest over. Kthanksbye!
A DRAW? That's worse than losing!
Wait, wait, wait, wait!
You can't leave the TV viewing public of Snuggford hanging - we are VESTED in this!
We need a final epic challenge - a tie breaker!
I agree!
Tie breaker! Tie breaker!
You're certainly in a good mood.
I am...
You're not worried about the final challenge?
Not even a little. I’ve seen what you have to do to win contests on TV and, well... I'd rather be a good dad.
You ARE - you always have been.
But this contest has opened my eyes to all the work you do around here.
I'm going to pitch in more, I promise. And I mean REALLY pitch in - not only when you tell me to.
I suppose there were simpler ways to get it across - but the contest seemed like such a fun idea... at first.
No... No, I think it WAS a good idea. I needed that wake-up call, and what better way to get me to listen?
Oh, I'm sure I could have thought of something...
Okay, I've got it all figured out!
WHAT is THIS?
Sumo suits! It's the final challenge, so we can't pull any punches - literally!
The best father needs to be also the STRONGEST!
Are you out of your mind?
Pass - I'm good with a four-way tie.
Me too - and so's my boss.
I can't find Andy, anyways, and he won't return my calls.
What's the matter guys, CHICKEN?
Excuse me?
You heard what I said - bok, bok, bok! Bok!
Chad!
Bok! Bok! Bok! Bok! Bok! Bok!
Bok! Bok! Bok! Bok! Bok! Bok!
Oshi!
I don't know, Francois...
Come on, Patrick! Yori!
Please, Francois - like Patrick's going to take part in this silly fight.
What?! But it's the grand finale!
Emily's right - I couldn't care less about the contest!
Right - and you have nothing to prove!
Although... I REALLY want to teach Chad a lesson...
Well, he still hasn't learnt anything... Poor Sharon...
And he DID try to use the twins to cheat...
You know what...?
Oooshi!
Tsuki!
Your luck stops here, Chad!
Please - on my last trip to Japan, my sumo instructor made me an honorary komusubi!
He said I was like a tsunami with legs.
LEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEET'S GET READY TO RUUUUUUUUUUUMBLE!!!!!!
AAAAARGH! H-HELP!!
Yori, Patrick! Yori!
RAWRRRRRR!
Throw him out!
Vito! Your first time crawling! Did you crawl over here to check on Daddy?
I'm okay, little buddy.
Here is your winner, by disqualification... CHAD!
Oh, yeah! Ha ha! Where's the camera?
Forget Chad - I want footage of this intimate father-son moment, it's gold!
You're the best daddy ever!
Well done, Patrick!
Da-da, da-da!
That was a very selfless thing to do, Patrick.
Hello? Sharon!! Anyone? Snuggford's official father-of-the-year over here!
How about some celebratory chocolate chip cookies?
Cookies?!
Folks, Patrick is a hero in this town! The people LOVE him! They want more!
We’ve gotta find a way to keep this thing going - ride the momentum! I'm thinking merchandising, music videos, theme park rights...
We're not doing any of that. But I have an idea...
So what I'm suggesting is a non-challenge, really - no competition, just for fun...
Each of us dads prepares a special surprise for our kids, while the moms get to kick back and enjoy.
What? No competition? Who's gonna want to watch that?!
It's okay. We'll do it just for us.
What about Patrick versus Chad in a tree chopping competition? Hot coal walking?
Get out!
Fine! C'mon, Gus - we'll find some other fools that actually want to make money.
Daddy! Daddy! What's my surprise gonna be?!
Well, the contest is over, but I guess we could prepare something...
...After my trip to Hong Kong. Should only be three weeks.
Hi, Sharon, just dropping off Chad's 'trophy' - a 'World's Greatest Dad' mug, hehe.
...Thanks.
I'll uh... I'll just set it down right here, then.
Chad DESERVED to win, you know...
Very well, if that's how you feel.
It's not how I feel, it's the truth!
I'm sorry. I... I don't know why I did that.
Actually, that's not true. I do know why...
I wanted Chad to win so bad because I'm jealous. Jealous of you all...
Truth is, I'd rather have an imperfect husband at home than a 'perfect' one who's never here.
In the end, I guess I'm the one who needed this contest the most.
Are you sure about this, guys? We could still make some money!
How about a reality show? All eight of you, kids and all, locked in the same house!
Okay, last chance! Cash cow walking away here!
No, seriously, are you- Okay, okay!!

Room6_Text.text: Evelyn's Place
Okay peanut - for your surprise, we'll be baking some cookies together! And you can choose what cookies we're making - anything goes!
Chocolate chips! Wait! Strawberry cookies... No, I got it!
Jelly bean gummi worm cookies!
Oookay!
Ooh! Ooh! And we should make a batch of unicorn sugar cookies!
Love it!
Emily! All the TV viewers are going nuts wanting to know what surprises the dads have planned for their kids...
Well, I guess we can keep streaming it on my video blog - if you're up for it, I mean.
Am I ever!
But let me say something first.
Hey, everyone out there! Instead of just watching from home, why don't you join in the fun?
If you want to prepare a surprise for your kids too, come on over! We'll cook something together!
Emily - that was brilliant. Our brand health sentiment index ratings will be off the chart!
Wow, she's really getting good at all this stuff!
Whoa! Do these look good!
You know, Patrick? Seeing how much fun these kids are having is the best prize any of us could wish for.
Mommy doesn't let me put jelly beans in her cookies!
Really? Why's that?
I guess that's why. Your mommy does know a lot about cooking, peanut!
You know, this is much better than the first cookies I ever made!
Time for my surprise, kids!
Double upside down pancake cake!
YAAAAY!
YAAAAY!
YAAAAY!
YAAAAY!
Now uh... let's see. Is it baking soda I need or baking powder?
I'll get it-
No, no! I got this...
It uh... it doesn't look quite like I thought it would.
The presentation doesn't matter if it tastes delicious!
It's um... COUGH! COUGH! Delicious!
Water, please!
Mmm! Tastes like barkdust!
Mmm! Tastes like spiders!
Well, looks I've got some work to do to get that recipe down...
You do... but in the meantime, your best will do just fine.
I heard you had some delicious cookies over here.
Paige's recipe.
Mommy! Mommy! Where's Daddy?
He's on another work trip, princess. He'll be back before too long.
Grace - Paige wants to try a new cookie recipe. Want to help?
Want to talk?
If it's all the same to you, do you mind if we just sit down and have some coffee?
Of course.
Hello, everyone! Wow, I feel like it's been forever since I did a normal video blog...
Anyhow, my friend and neighbor Sharon, and I, have decided that the men have been having all the fun lately!
So, Sharon...?
So, we're going to mud wrestle.
Kidding! We're going to make a citrus olive oil cake.
Chad? I thought you were on a business trip?
I was...
...but only so I could turn in my resignation.
I want to be home... with you and Grace.
Wait...
Does that mean we're poor now?
No word from Andy, huh?
Long gone. Probably touring with his band somewhere.
Funny - I was just beginning to think he had REALLY changed.
I feel partly responsible. If it weren't for this silly contest...
No... It was thanks to this contest he realized what it meant to be a father... To REALLY love a son...
But finding out he didn't know his own son as well as he should was a big blow for sure...
In any case, it was his decision to bail... again.
It's what he does.
Well... uh, it looks like we're all done with the dad's surprises for now.
Now, I know a lot of you will be disappointed. So I've made sure to-
Stop, right therrrrrrrre!
Mary-Lynn! I'm back - and my surprise for Levi is ready!
My surprise is waiting in the garden. Come with me!
Thanks for coming, guys. 3, 2, 1...
How could a part of me become you? Lovely Levi... So small, so innocent and new... And now I see that...
My life was a wash, a lost lonely sailor on a ship blowing out to sea...
What kind of man would I be if I didn't have Levi with me?
I talk a lot about love, true - my sweet Levi... But what's a love-struck dad to do... And I believe I...
Really thought I knew it all, but something clicked, tore down my walls, and now I see... This piece of me...
And I believe - yes, I believe, we're the perfect three - Mary-Lynn, Levi and me.
I admit I'm still working on the new lyrics, so there's just some humming here and then the bridge goes something like-
Andy, where WERE you?
I was feeling sorry for myself... I felt like such a disappointment, I just wanted to bail.
Again...
Mary-Lynn, I used to be scared that being a father would mean losing my freedom...
But now, the thought of not knowing Levi scares me SO much more than that.
I want to spend as much time with him as I can. We can do a formal custody arrangement, a weekly calendar - you name it.
Andy, you won't get to know him overnight, these things take time.
But if you're up for it - if you're serious, we'll have a lot of time from now on...
...together.
One thing though - don't give up on your music. As long as you're not on tour all the time... we'll make it work.
Done.
Now, let's go home, okay?
Daddy! Daddy! Let's go play outside with Emmy and Vito!
Ooh! We could try out your new marshmallow gun! I-
Actually, you know what, sweetpea? Daddy has a LOT of cleaning up to do here, first.
Why don't you guys go outside and play with mommy? Hmm?
Good girl.
Thanks, honey.
Look, Vito! Look! A butterfly!
Ma aa! Ma aa! Ma ma!
Mama! That's right, sweetie! I'm your mama!
Mama! Mama! Mama!
Your first words!
You want to play with Chirpy too, Vito?
Chi-pi! Chi-pi!
You know, it's thanks to your great grandpa Vito that Chirpy is here with us now, sweetie.
Oh, Grandpa! I wish you were here to watch them grow up... You'd be SO proud.
Chad? What's up?
Oh, not much. I just uh... er...
I wanted to thank you for helping me see the light. You're a good father, Patrick.
Wow... thank you, Chad.
You uh... you want a hand?
Sure! Grab a towel, you can dry.
Bet I can wash dishes faster than you...
Bet you can't.
No, seriously - wanna bet?
NO.
Emily, these viewer metrics for your video blog are AMAZING.
I know! Nora's done a fantastic job.
You really ought to think of raising some capital so you can expand!
You could buy new equipment, get a marketing campaign going, look for formal distribution.
Hey, hey ladies! LOVE what you did with the dad surprises - lots of buzz! Lots of HEAT!
Listen, how about we re-up your contract? I could offer you executive producer cred-
You know... it's not too late to plan a surprise for Grace if you'd like...
I've actually thought of something - but with those viewership numbers on Emily's video blog...
...I'm a bit embarrassed, to be honest. If I make a fool of myself and that many people see it-
Listen - do you think Grace will love it?
Then what's there to think about?
Where's daddy, mommy?
He'll be here any minute now, princess - I promise.
He's not coming!
It's the Nutcracker! My favorite!!
Ladies and gentlemen, I've decided Grace and I will hold a little impromptu ballet recital. Grace?
Hey... where's Vito?
Come on, little brother! Show them what you can do!
Vito! You're standing?
What was that you said about 'girls being faster than boys?'
That's Emmy... JUST when we got Vito to sleep through the night, too.
You go back to sleep. I'll get her.
Well, don't try to argue or anything.
WAAAAAAAA!
Okay, peanut - mom's off duty. What am I going to have to do to get you to chill out?
I guess the 'magic touch' doesn't always work...
Patrick?
Dada! Da-da!
Okay, everyone. I think we can safely say that the first - and last - Snuggford Father of the Year competition is OVER!
As a token of our appreciation, us ladies are throwing you guys a delicious barbecue!
Everyone, dig in!
Is this really the LAST ever father of the year competition? Such a shame - it's done so much good.
It was quite an adventure for sure - but next time I need Patrick to know how I'm feeling...
I'll just talk to him about it.
Come on guys, let's wrap things up in the kitchen while we get everything ready!
Everyone, Sharon and I have an announcement...
I'm taking my kite collection to the beach - where they can be used for the purpose for which they were intended!
Imagine that.
You're all invited to come stay with us at the beach house - there's plenty of room!
Come stay before we're forced to sell it!
Mom, Dad? You coming?
Later dear - you go ahead. We'll clean up.
Are you sure?
It's no problem at all, really!
Well, should we get started with the dishes?
What? I- I thought... I was just going to vacuum...
Edward... I love that you do that - BUT I still need more help around the house.
You do have a point...
C'mon - let's go wash the dishes together.
The End
I mean, even after what happened at the sumo battle, he still doesn't get it?
I spent so many years pretending I was happy, I started believing it myself...
You need to talk to him, Sharon - tell him how you feel.
I don't want to lose everything I have, but...
Would you like to appear in my next video blog? It'll be fun!
